results.title: Spring Culture Fell to Virus. In Oregon, Summer Theater Now Succumbs.
results.abstract: As nonprofits around the country cancel all spring programs, the Oregon Shakespeare Festival halts performances through Labor Day, and will lay off 80 percent of its staff.

multimedia.caption: The festival will postpone live productions until after Labor Day. Its flagship stage is the outdoor Allen Elizabethan Theater, which seats up to 1,200 people.
multimedia.copyright: Kim Budd via Oregon Shakespeare Festival

results.title: Weaving a Way Out of Isolation
results.abstract: You can craft your way to a sense of community, says the artist Liza Lou. She's creating her "comfort" project on Instagram in real time.

multimedia.caption: Liza Lou in her studio, with "Sunday Morning" (2019), oil paint on woven glass beads and thread on canvas.

results.title: Turn the Living Room into a Stage: Read Plays Out Loud
results.abstract: It's a tradition this drama critic would highly recommend to those looking for ways to find magic in empty hours.

results.title: Krzysztof Penderecki, Polish Composer With Cinematic Flair, Dies at 86
results.abstract: Mr. Penderecki's modernist compositions turned up in films like "The Exorcist" and influenced a generation of edgy rock musicians.

multimedia.caption: Krzysztof Penderecki conducting the Philharmonia Orchestra of Yale at Carnegie Hall in 2010. In addition to his work as a composer, he had a lucrative career as conductor of the Krakow Symphony and as a guest conductor abroad.
multimedia.copyright: Richard Termine for The New York Times
